name: Super 8 Nashville Airport Music City Area

reviews.text: Good quality Super8 establishment. Room was slightly smaller than usual, but had just been refitted, and indeed, the skirting boards had not yet been reattached, giving the room a slightly unfinished look. However, it was clean, and all the facilities worked well.
reviews.title: Good motel but intrusive aircraft noise
Good for the Money, Great Staff
reviews.text: Breakfast choice was good, including a waffle maker, and eggs and sausage - the latter wasn't great, but when breakfast is free one can hardly complain.

Front desk was very obliging in meeting my request for a room away from the main road. However, what I did not realise until 5-30am was that it faced the (very adjacent) airport runway, and for the next 90 minutes I became intimately acquainted with Nashville airport's start of day flight schedule, as planes seemingly took off out of the hotel car park opposite. If you are a deep sleeper, fine: if not, ask for a room on the side away from the airport, or book a motel further away.
reviews.title: Beware***crooked, dishonest establishment

reviews.text: I've given this a 4 star score, but that's only if you can deal with the bellowing engine roar of regular takeoffs from 5-30am.
reviews.title: average place to stay

likes.liked: — location - near to highway and airport
likes.disliked: — needs some freshening up, looks tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the money - you can't beat it. It was everything we needed and even a few extras. For a $75/night hotel we were really surprised by both the staff and amenities. There are several airport hotels in the same area as this one, but none that offered everything we needed AND a 24 hour shuttle except this one. We parked our vehicle at the hotel for less than half than it would have cost at the airport, and they provided a free shuttle to the airport the next morning. The girl that drove the shuttle talked on her phone the entire way to the airport in broken english, but it was a very short drive and she was nice enough i suppose.
reviews.title: Singing the Blues in Music City

reviews.text: A friend of mine and I were too tired to make the full drive home and decided to stop off at the super 8 motel. We expected it to be cheap and probably yucky, but we just needed it for a few hours of sleep. We were really surprised! The staff was great the hotel was very clean it needed a little updating but thats to be expected from a Super 8. The room was a smoking room and yes it did smell like smoke but the room was in great shape and very clean and all of the toiletries were there and the paper products were all folded and there were plenty of towels, the linens were clean and smelled nice. There was only 1 burn hole in the top cover but it was a smoking room. Check out was quick and painless. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Great hotel for the money!

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel several times because the price is good......however, each time (and I stay for a week about every month) that I have stayed, they have messed up my reservation, booking me several rooms (I travel alone) and losing my reservations. The most recent was during June when I was to have a room with two beds (I had a friend staying with me) for the week of June 4-12......The week of Fan Fair In Nashville. The hotel LOST my reservation, then said that they could give me a room with 1 bed, but at a much higher rate. Needless to say, I only stayed the nights that I was rooming alone. NOW, they have charged my Debit card for two more rooms for a night THREE nights AFTER I flew home. I am fighting them for the $142 charge on my account, but they are saying I had a reservation and was a No Show. Trust me,,,,,,,,,,I didnt have a reservation. I think they screwed up my ORIGINAL reservation and are now charging me for the wrong dates that they entered. Anyway, I have had nothing but problems with this hotel and their "reservation" system, and now that they have my card information, turns out they can charge my card and there is NOTHING I can do about it. Steer clear of this hotel, several of my friends have had problems with them too.
reviews.title: Stay Away!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another thing, each time I have been there, the pool has been closed, even though they say that it will be open when I get there, and staying as often as I do, you think it would have been open at least once.
reviews.title: Okay place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at this Super 8 overnight before leaving for another destination. I was very concerned after reading the reviews, but we didn't have any problems. The rooms were sort of small, and the hallways smelled a little smoky, but other than that, it seemed like a typical Super 8.
reviews.title: drug paraphanellia found
Stay ANYWHERE but HERE!!!
reviews.text: While staying there we found drug para. behind the ice machine. When we approach the staff about it they did not seem concerned at all. Also, constant traffic in and out of motel all night. Dust and dirt was found all over the curtains and the air conditioner looked as though it had never been cleaned. Water from unit was on the floor by the bed. We had stayed here several times prior and liked the place. But, this time a real change for the worst and we will not go back. We reported this to corporate office and never received a response. This is no longer a family place.

reviews.title: Bang for your Buck
reviews.text: I had the pleasure to visit Nashville for a week....stayed at the Super 8 on Royal Parkway.....got a great deal for our dollar.....the rooms were very clean, pool was wonderful with a sunroom to boot.....only $209 for the whole week. Plenty of restaurants and shopping close by, only 15 minutes to downtown....If you a looking for a great deal, check out Super 8 on Royal Parkway......

reviews.title: Great Hotel if you are on a budget
reviews.text: I was a regular customer at this hotel when I had business in Nashville during 1999-2001. I was very satisfied with all of my experiences. This hotel has a lot of advantages and a few disadvantages. First, the advantages are that it is a clean, interior corridor hotel in a very safe business district, it has amenities like a large indoor pool, elevator, electronic locks, and a limited continental breakfast, all at a great budget price. The disadvantages are that the hotel was built in 1989 and has not had a major renovation since, there was some mold on the ceiling of the indoor pool (the ceiling was all wood) and some of the tv's only had a few channels. All in all, it is a great place to stay, just don't expect 4-star accomodations. One of the best economy hotels in Nashville. They let my parents park their car there when they flew to Phoenix for a vacation. I would definitely recommend this hotel to budget-minded business travelers or anyone looking for affordable accomodations in Nashville. Hotelman (My Screen Name)

aka: Super 8 Airport - Nashville / Music City Hotel
description: Airport Super 8 Nashville/Music City/Opryland is 100% Smoke-free hotel, conveniently located just a mile from Nashville Airport, 5 miles to Grand Ole Opry and 8 miles to downtown Nashville. With entire hotel renovations completed in April 2008, we offer the following Amenities:100% smoke free hotel,Interior Corridors, Complimentary 24 hrs Airport Shuttle (daily), Park and Fly Packages available, Complimentary Breakfast (sausage, biscuits, gravy, eggs, make-yourself waffles, Fresh fruits, cereal), Indoor Pool, Pool side Jacuzzi & Fitness Center,Complimentary Business center & Complimentary Wireless Internet throughout hotel, Group rates available, and Lots of restaurants within a block to satisfy every palate.
